meanings.definition: Used to express surprise or disbelief.
meanings.sent1: Quotha! I never expected to see a talking dog!
meanings.sent2: Well, quotha, that certainly caught me off guard!
meanings.sent3: Quotha, a flying pig! What a sight!
meanings.sent4: The magician pulled a rabbit out of a hat, quotha, like magic!
meanings.sent5: The sudden thunderstorm took us by surprise, quotha, with its loud thunder.

meanings.sent1: She quotha that she would be late for the meeting.
meanings.sent2: He quotha his favorite quote from the movie.
meanings.sent3: The parrot quotha the words it had learned from its owner.
meanings.sent4: The news anchor quotha the breaking news to the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The teacher quotha the instructions clearly to the students.
